definition: to pursue closely
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

sentences.english: He took off after me, vainly trying to land a blow.
sentences.chinese: 他在后面紧追不舍，总想打到我。

sentences.english: Not far behind him was Lin Tao.
The hound nips at a rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 猎犬在野兔身后紧追不舍。

sentences.english: The police kept after the criminal until they finally caught him.
sentences.chinese: 警方对那个罪犯紧追不舍，直至最后把他抓获。

sentences.english: The boy rushed past me with a policeman close on his heels.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩从我身边飞奔而过，有个警察紧追在后。

sentences.english: The thief ran off down the road , so I chased him for all I was worth .
sentences.chinese: 那贼顺着马路逃跑，我就拼命紧追不舍。

sentences.english: The partisans managed to get away, although the enemy was hot on their tracks.
sentences.chinese: 虽然敌人紧追不舍，游击队员们还是设法跑掉了。

sentences.english: Wounded haze it running in the woods, the day a group of soldiers followed behind.
sentences.chinese: 负伤的岚么在树林中奔跑，身后一群日兵紧追不舍。

sentences.english: The shark, excited by the smell of blood and the chase, went after him.
sentences.chinese: 那条鲨鱼受到血腥味以及捕食的刺激，紧追在他后头。
并购狂潮紧追绿色趋势。

sentences.english: The taxi driver saw him and ran after him.
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机看见了他，在后面紧追不放。

sentences.english: Top would be fine, but to be near the top would mean the run-in would present us with an opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 头名当然好，但紧追领头羊意味着我们还有机会。

sentences.english: Now in our school there is a hot pursuit of fashion.
sentences.chinese: 现在在我们学校有一股紧追时尚的风气。

sentences.english: In most, though, he is nipping at Mr Romney’s heels.
sentences.chinese: 尽管大多数调查中，凯恩是紧追罗姆尼其后。

sentences.english: A snarling swarm of razor-toothed green monsters is hot on his heels.
sentences.chinese: 一大群牙尖齿利的绿色怪兽在他身后紧追不舍。

sentences.english: He kept running desperately chased by two police.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命地逃，后面两个警察紧追不舍。

definition: to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to overtake
to pursue and attack
to follow precisely/to comply with
to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)
to tail behind/to tag along/to follow on the heels of
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to shake off/to get rid of
to take the lead
to pursue relentlessly
to approach/to press in
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to charge forward
to run away/to flee in disarray
not to be outdone
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
